Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
I am having trouble with the getblockhashes api of KMD, 
```
$ komodo-cli getblockhashes 1474117241 1474115846
error code: -5
error message:
No information available for block hashes
```

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: is timestampindex=1 set

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: No. I should set this in .conf and restart the daemon?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: from commandline, or i guess .conf, without it there wont be any timestamp data

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: from commandline while starting the daemon?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: I've started komodod :`./komodod -timestampindex=1` and blocks are synced. Still getting the same above error

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
was timestampindex active when the blocks: $ komodo-cli getblockhashes 1474117241 1474115846
 were synced?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: I don't think so. How do I make it reindex?
